message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.GT

This paper discusses a routing scheme in wireless ad hoc networks, which falls under the category of networked systems (cs.NI). The paper also uses Markov processes to model the packet distance evolution, which is a common technique in information theory (cs.IT). The paper derives sufficient conditions for convergence, which involves analyzing the behavior of the routing scheme over time, and this is a topic in the field of dynamical systems (cs.DS). The paper also discusses the expected number of hops that each packet traverses, which is a metric commonly used in the analysis of routing algorithms in wireless networks (cs.SI). Finally, the paper uses probabilistic techniques to analyze the behavior of the routing scheme, which is a topic in the field of game theory (cs.GT).
